|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = Lexra |cpu1_type_rev = LX5280 |cpu1spd = 180 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Macronix;MX29LV160CBTC-70G; |flash1size = 2 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 16 |ram1chip = ISSI;IS42S16800A-7TL; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth1chip = Realtek;RTL8201CP; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = |oui = 00:1A:50 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = btcode;;; |stockos = Linux;2.4.18;MIPS-01.00; |exp_if_types = |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, 4-pin header,, JPU1 |jtag = yes,, 12-pad header,, J1 |specialfeat = |flags = high power |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bg |defaulip = 192.168.1.254 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = PheeNet |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = Wive-NG |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 2007 |estprice = 50 |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = Taiwan |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== See also ''Pheenet WAP-654GP'' (int. splitter PoE) :2.2dBi detachable antenna (RP-SMA conn.) Base Platform: RTL8186 + RL2560 (MIPS R3000 ISA-1) [http://www.ciudadwireless.com/pheenet_wap-654g_ieee802-11g_54mbps_b-repetidor_universal-p-1431.html Spec.] Very simple access point with WIFI high output power (200mW) :that allows several wifi modes: * AP, WDS, AP + WDS, Client bridged, Ad-hoc * AP + Client bridged (aka Universal Repeater) The original firmware doesn't have Telnet or other remote CLI interface. :It only can be configured via web interface. It is worth mentioning the web interface doesn't allow to reboot the router, :however there is a hidden page that allows to execute custom commands: htt—Ä://192.168.1.254/syscmd.asp Some useful commands:
* Change the MAC adresss
flash set HW_WLAN0_WLAN_ADDR 001122334455
flash set HW_NIC0_ADDR 001122334455 * Change the regulatory domain
flash set HW_WLAN0_REG_DOMAIN 6 ==Links of Interest== :[http://www.ciudadwireless.com/pheenet_wap-654g_ieee802-11g_54mbps_b-repetidor_universal-p-1431.html Product page] ([http://www.pheenet.com/product/product_info?id=283&category_id=67&parent_id=6 Old]) ([http://www.pheenet.com/solutions?id=380 New]) :[http://www.pheenet.com/support?page=10 Support page] :[http://www.solwise.co.uk/downloads/files/wap-654g.pdf Datasheet] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Tested firmwares=== Third party firmwares like [https://sourceforge.net/projects/wive-ng/ Wive-NG] were successfully tested in this unit. {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Version ! Link ! Notes |- | OEM 1.4c | [https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1PgJ-xZ5CoVopv2_0eSxG3B7EQ9szdJth WAP-654G(P)_v1.4c.zip] | doesn't seem to flash via tftp |- | OEM 1.4b | [https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=0B-EMoBe-_OdBY3cwSmhtbU8xUFk WAP-654G(P), F v1.4b 070228.rar] | |- | Wive-NG 0.3.18 | [https://sourceforge.net/projects/wive-ng/files/wive-ng/wive-ng-0.3.x/wive-ng-0.3.18.tar.7z wive-ng-0.3.18.tar.7z] | no web interface |- | Dlink 1.41-1 | [https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1aNtJI0oiG8euc8566Gt2Megt6472JZxJ DAP1160A1-OEM_MOD-1.41.zip] | modded firmware from Dlink DAP1160A1 GPL |} ===Flash backup=== # Connect the serial UART Adapter. Also connect the ethernet cable. # Set a static IP on your computer, use 192.168.1.35 (or any compatible) # Press the reset button, don't release it yet # Plug the power cord, and wait 5 seconds # Release the reset button # On the serial console execute the command: flr 80300000 0 200000 # On your computer execute: tftp 192.168.1.6 -m binary -c get flash-backup.bin You should see something like this at the serial console 
flr 80300000 0 200000
Flash read from 00000000 to 80300000 with 00200000 bytes ?
(Y)es , (N)o ? --> y
Flash Read Successed!

File Start: 80300000,length=00200000

**TFTP GET File flbackup.bin,Size 00200000 Byte
*TFTP Client Download Success! File Size = 00200000 Bytes
.Success!
=== Recovery === If you bricked the router by flashing a bad firmware follow these steps: # Connect the ethernet cable from your computer to the device. # Set a static IP on your computer, use 192.168.1.35 (or any compatible) # Press the reset button, don't release it yet # Plug the power cord, and wait 5 seconds # Release the reset button # On your computer execute: tftp 192.168.1.6 -m binary -c put valid-firmware.bin ''valid-firmware.bin'' is supposed to be a known firmware working ok on this device ===Serial=== {{/Serial info}} ==Pictures==
'''User Images''' File:wap-654g-board_top.jpg|board top File:wap-654g-board_bottom.jpg|board bottom File:wap-654g-case.jpg|casing File:wap-654g-uart-jtag.jpg|serial port and JTAG
[[Has images::internal| ]][[Has images::external| ]] ==Notes== === Power regulators === * AnaChip AP1506-50 (U9 silkcreened): Main power regulator,12V input, 5V output * BS33P (U38 silkcreened): Low dropout regulator, 5V input, 3.3V output * BS17P (U10 silkcreened): Low dropout regulator (adjustable), 5V input, 3.1V output * BS18P (U8 silkcreened): Low dropout regulator, 5V input, 1.8V output. It runs extremely hot, probably causing unstability problems. It's recommended to install the bigger heat sink as possible. [[File:Wap-654g-power_regulators.jpg|400px]] [[Category:English Documentation]]
